title: 107_hr1390
content: The "Child Care Worker Incentive Act of 2001" includes a National Child Care Provider Scholarship Program. The "Child Care Worker Incentive Act of 2001" establishes a Child Care Provider Scholarship Program in states to support recruitment, training, credentialing, and retention of child care providers. Eligibility criteria for scholarship applicants are outlined in the state plan. The individual must demonstrate a commitment to a child care career by being employed by a licensed child care provider or having a commitment for employment. They must agree to continue working in the field for at least one year after receiving training. The individual is also required to share the costs of the program. The individual, employed by a licensed child care provider or with a commitment for employment, must share the cost of education or training, and apply for Pell Grants if eligible. The employer of such individual must meet specific requirements. The State plan for education or training programs requires the individual's employer to contribute to the cost and provide financial incentives upon completion. Qualifying institutions include those eligible for student financial assistance programs under title IV. The State plan for education or training programs requires employer contribution and financial incentives for completion. Qualifying institutions must be eligible for student financial assistance programs under title IV. Scholarship grants under this section are capped at $1,500 per year and cannot supplant existing funds for related services. Section 658B of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 is amended to authorize $50,000,000 for the Child Care Provider Scholarship Program annually from 2002 to 2006. Section 658O is also amended to specify allotment details for the program. Section 658B of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 is amended to authorize $50,000,000 annually for the Child Care Provider Scholarship Program from 2002 to 2006. Section 658J(a) is also amended to specify payment details for states with child care scholarship programs. The Child Care Provider Scholarship Program under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 is amended to include reporting requirements on the number of scholarship grants, amount of grants, course credits completed, and percentage of child care workers benefiting from the program. The Child Care Provider Scholarship Program now includes reporting requirements on scholarship grants, course credits completed, and the percentage of child care workers fulfilling their 1-year commitment. The amendments made by this Act do not apply to fiscal years before the enactment date.
